Class Util

extends java.lang.Object
    Created by fabio on 26/10/2016. Gently from http://stackoverflow.com/questions/140131/convert-a-string-representation-of-a-hex-dump-to-a-byte-array-using-java with some enhancement...

      • zeroPadArray

        public static byte[] zeroPadArray(byte[] source,
                                  int size)
        Pad a byte array with zeroes. If Source array length exceed size, then truncate it.
        Parameters:
        source - The source array
        size - The final array size
        Returns:
        The array of size elements eventually zero-padded

      • getBytesAtOffset

        public static byte[] getBytesAtOffset(java.nio.ByteBuffer buffer,
                                      int offset,
                                      int length)
        Given a ByteBuffer get bytes in an absolute offset without altering its current position.

        The operation is synchronized over the buffer to avoid thread interference.

        Parameters:
        buffer - The ByteBuffer to read data from
        offset - The absolute offset from which starting to extract data
        length - How many bytes to extract
        Returns:
        The exctracted bytes as a byte array

      • setBytesAtOffset

        public static void setBytesAtOffset(java.nio.ByteBuffer buffer,
                                    int offset,
                                    int length,
                                    byte[] data)
        Given a ByteBuffer set bytes in an absolute offset without altering its current position.

        The operation is synchronized over the buffer to avoid thread interference.

        Parameters:
        buffer - The ByteBuffer to write data to
        offset - The absolute offset from which starting to write data
        length - How many bytes to write
        data - The data to write into the ByteBuffer
